summary: This is an email chain from November 24, 2021, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing media guidance for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It provides off-the-record guidance about witness pseudonyms and lists the charges and maximum penalties Maxwell faced.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant facing trial on six counts related to sex trafficking and transporting minors for illegal sex acts. The document lists the maximum penalties for each charge.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued a trial logistics order that is referenced as being attached to the email.

events.title: Email discussing Maxwell trial media guidance
events.description: Internal email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office discussing and approving off-the-record media guidance regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The ongoing trial of Ghislaine Maxwell on six federal counts related to sex trafficking and transporting minors for illegal sexual activity.

keyFacts: The Court ruled that several government witnesses, who are not alleged victims themselves, could testify under pseudonyms to protect the identities of alleged victims.

Ghislaine Maxwell faced six federal charges with maximum penalties totaling up to 70 years in prison, with the most severe being Count Five (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors) carrying a 40-year maximum.
The email provides internal 'off-the-record guidance' urging media to respect witness privacy and not identify sex crime victims without consent.
The correspondence shows coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding media strategy during the Maxwell trial.
